admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

authors.authr: Chinese Research Academy of Environmental Sciences

trustfund:
TF026661-PHRD-CHINA: HEBEI URBAN
            ENVIRONMENT PROJECT -- ENVIRONMENTAL POLLUTION

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Hebei Urban Environmental Project , which develops
            wastewater treatment projects in several cities discusses
            expected adverse environmental impacts. They will be
            mitigated as follows: Construction activities will adopt low
            noise machinery and night work will be prohibited near
            residential areas. Sludge will be disposed of at municipal
            sanitary landfills, if not used as composite fertilizer, and
            the residue treated with lime before being disposed of.
            Discarded earth and construction waste will be transported
            to dump sites (sink pits). Sprinkle water on dust and cover
            transporting vehicles. To relieve traffic congestion,
            temporary roads will be paved at heavy traffic sections and
            materials transported during non-rush hours. A buffer
            greenbelt will be built to reduce odors from emissions, and
            trees replanted after construction, particularly along
            roadsides after road restoration. Use discarded earth and
            construction waste as backfill earth. Level excavated land,
            cover it with cultivated soil, and restore vegetation.
            Discharge wastewater into the sewage system. To prevent
            chlorine leakage in the pumping station, operational
            management will be strengthened. Box-net fishing which
            causes eutrophication will be banned. Strengthen soil
            conservation to prevent pollution from farmland and village
            runoff by more efficiently using chemical fertilizers and
            pesticides, and tightening control of animal excrement, and
            garbage collection.
